term.title: anticodon

item.text: A sequence of three nucleotides in the anticodon-loop of a tRNA, which recognizes and binds the complementary triplet sequence (codon) of the mRNA.

sources.item: PAC, 1992, 64, 143. 'Glossary for chemists of terms used in biotechnology (IUPAC Recommendations 1992)' on page 146 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199264010143)

term.citation: Citation: 'anticodon' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.A00389

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
